meanings.definition: The quality or state of being social.
meanings.sent1: Her sociality shines through in every interaction she has.
meanings.sent2: The club's success is due to the sociality of its members.
meanings.sent3: His sociality is so contagious that everyone wants to be around him.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of chaos, her sociality is a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The sociality of the community made everyone feel welcomed and included.

meanings.definition: The tendency to form cooperative and interdependent relationships with others.
meanings.sent1: Their sociality led to successful collaborations on various projects.
meanings.sent2: The sociality among the team members was evident in their seamless teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The sociality between the two rival groups was unexpected but heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, sociality can be the key to unlocking new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The sociality within the family made even the toughest challenges easier to overcome.

meanings.definition: The extent to which an organism engages in social behavior.
meanings.sent1: The researcher studied the sociality of ants in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent2: The sociality of the primates was fascinating to observe in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The sociality of the bees in the hive was crucial for their survival.
meanings.sent4: The sociality of the wolves in the pack ensured their collective success.
meanings.sent5: The sociality of the dolphins in the pod was a sight to behold.
